title: Zelensky Gets Hero’s Welcome in Poland, Cementing Ukraine’s Ties
description: Polish leaders backed Ukraine’s bid for NATO membership, but even without that, Russia’s invasion is making the alliance’s eastern flank more united, and more important.

title: Putin and Lukashenko to Discuss Deepening Ties Between Russia and Belarus
description: The leader of Belarus is in Russia for talks on Thursday.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: Diplomatic Visits Highlight Tension With China
description: Also, what’s next for Donald Trump and Israeli police raid a Jerusalem mosque.

title: Italian Ex-Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi Is Hospitalized
description: The 86-year-old businessman-turned-politician, now a senator, was admitted to an intensive care unit in Milan. He was said to have a “problem related to a previous infection.”

title: Biden’s Ambassador to Israel, at the Center of the Storm
description: A longtime Democratic insider, Thomas Nides navigates a fraught U.S.-Israel relationship with humor, if a sometimes all-too-quotable candor.

title: China faces pressure to rein in Russia, but may have limited sway.
Macron, in China, Says He’ll Urge Xi to Work for Peace in Ukraine
description: President Emmanuel Macron of France spoke of the need for a “shared responsibility for peace and international stability.”

title: McCarthy Meets With Tsai, Backing Taiwan Amid Rising Tensions With China
description: Speaker Kevin McCarthy became the most senior elected official to meet with a Taiwanese president on American soil since the United States established diplomatic relations with Beijing.

title: Tunisia’s Influence in Europe
description: The European Union relies heavily on Tunisia to stem migration, giving its increasingly authoritarian president leverage in negotiations with the bloc.

title: E.P.A. to Tighten Limits on Mercury and Other Pollutants From Power Plants
description: A new rule would reduce mercury, arsenic, nickel and lead emissions, which the Biden administration said would protect public health.

title: John Joseph Went to Australia for Gold, Then Stood Up for Democracy
description: John Joseph was put on trial for leading a miners’ rebellion seeking less taxation and more representation. His legacy was forgotten — until now.

title: Nicola Sturgeon’s Husband Arrested as Scottish Party Is Investigated
description: Peter Murrell, a longtime Scottish National Party official, was being questioned by the police, who have been looking into the handling of donations raised to campaign for a second independence vote.

title: Zelensky Travels to Poland to Meet With a Staunch Ally
description: The Ukrainian president is meeting with his Polish counterpart and is expected to address the many Ukrainians living in Poland. Here is what we’re covering.

title: Donald Trump’s Day in Court
description: The case against him is about more than Stormy Daniels.

title: How a Tiny Literary Magazine Became a Springboard for Great Irish Writing
description: The Stinging Fly has helped launch several of Ireland’s most promising writers. How has a publication with 1,000 subscribers carved a niche in the Irish canon?

title: Polish Leaders Hope Defense of a Dead Pope Propels Them to Re-Election
description: Criticism of John Paul II, the canonized, Polish-born pope who is a national hero, has fueled anger that the governing party wants to turn into votes.

title: African Students Who Fled Ukraine Face Legal Limbo in Europe
description: One student, accepted at a Georgian school, had her visa application rejected. Another, 18 months from his medical degree, received a deportation order from Germany. “It just makes you want to stop in the street and scream,” he said.

title: Jacinda Ardern’s Career in New Zealand Politics Ends
description: The former prime minister, who is now stepping down from Parliament, urged lawmakers to take action on climate change.

title: Israeli Police Raid Holy Site in Jerusalem, Prompting Rocket Fire From Gaza
description: Scores of Palestinians were arrested at the Aqsa Mosque compound, known to Jews as the Temple Mount, after barricading themselves inside.

title: Can China Make Peace in Ukraine? Macron Isn’t Saying No.
description: The French president hopes Beijing can be useful in pressing Russia to end the war in Ukraine. How exactly is not clear.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Criminal charges against Donald Trump.

title: China’s Ambassador to the E.U. Tries to Distance Beijing From Moscow
description: The ambassador, Fu Cong, said China was not on Russia’s side in the war in Ukraine. “‘No limit’ is nothing but rhetoric,” he said, referring to a statement from last year about the countries’ relationship.
